name: Kinside
headline: Powering the $648b Care Economy
description: Kinside powers bookings and payments for the $648B care economy. We’ve started with child care, a $136B category that despite being an essential and evergreen service, remains an undigitized space, driven mostly by cash.

founders.name: Abe Han, Founder
founders.description: Software engineer with design training – deep product expertise, with much experience in hiring and managing technical teams. Former engineering lead at HoneyBook, and previously founded Works.io.

founders.name: Shadiah Sigala, Founder
founders.description:
I'm a serial tech entrepreneur, now founding Kinside, a modern child care benefit.

Previously, I cofounded HoneyBook, a SaaS tech company that powers over 50,000 freelancers in managing their business and clients. I broke ground in my first generation Mexican-American family by receiving degrees from Harvard (Master's in Public Policy) and Pomona College (BA in Latin American Studies) by the age of 24.

I currently live in Los Angeles with my two gorgeous, rambunctious tots.

## The future of finding child care is here.
All the information you need to enroll in care you love, all in one place.
Find care

Now it is. Kinside creates a more transparent and supportive child care ecosystem for families, providers, employers and government agencies.
Get started

### Why we do what we do
## Real change happens when we partner together.
That’s why Kinside partners with employers, child care providers and government agencies to drive better outcomes for all.
**100%** of providers say Kinside helps them save hours every week.
**92%** of parents say they are satisfied with their Kinside child care match.
Counties on Kinside see up to **80%** of local provider inventory.
###  Parents love us 
![](https://res.cloudinary.com/kinside/image/upload/v1692192368/quote.svg)
I have never experienced this level of service. Kinside has been phenomenal from start to finish. It is always stressful to find new child care. The platform is easy to work through and straightforward.I want to especially thank my concierge who was positive, communicative, and took the stress out of finding a place that met our needs.
Sarah Z. Reddit 
![](https://res.cloudinary.com/kinside/image/upload/dpr_2,f_auto,q_auto:good/v1/app_assets/illustration-child2.png)

generated_description:
Kinside is shaking up a massive sector—childcare—by bringing it into the digital age. Founded in 2018 as part of Y Combinator's S18 batch, Kinside operates out of San Francisco and is on a mission to empower the burgeoning $648 billion care economy. Its focus right now? The $136 billion childcare market, a space that's surprisingly still driven largely by cash transactions and old-school practices.

What Kinside does is pretty fundamental yet innovative: it streamlines the booking and payment processes for childcare services, transforming what has historically been a cumbersome experience into something a bit more manageable. They’ve built a platform where parents can easily find, research, and book childcare options, which is especially significant in a world where parents juggle careers and family needs.

Currently, the team comprises 18 employees, led by notable figures, including Group Partner Michael Seibel from Y Combinator. Kinside’s platform separates user experiences into four primary roles—parents, childcare providers, employers, and government agencies—each navigating their unique paths but benefiting from the transparent ecosystem Kinside fosters.

Not just a directory of providers, Kinside highlights real-time availability, integrates payments, and even offers concierge-like support to help parents find the best local options. Users have responded positively: 92% of parents surveyed report satisfaction with their childcare match, and childcare providers say they save hours every week thanks to the system's efficiencies.

As they continue to develop and offer enhancements, Kinside is establishing itself as a critical player in modern childcare. If you're curious, check out their website at [Kinside.com](https://www.kinside.com) and see how they're redefining what it means to find and manage childcare in the 21st century.
